title: Synthetic Recap
body:
SAN ANTONIO (AP) — History arrived in the form of Gheorghe Muresan, and the San Antonio Spurs had no answer for the 7-foot-7 Romanian phenom. In a performance for the ages, Muresan delivered a stunningly dominant 50-point masterpiece to single-handedly dismantle the Spurs, 109-85, on their home floor.

From the opening tip, this was the Gheorghe Muresan Show. The gentle giant was an unstoppable force, imposing his will in the paint with an array of soft hooks, powerful dunks, and unerring accuracy from the field. He was a veritable scoring machine, leaving a trail of frustrated defenders in his wake as he piled up points in a way no Bullet had done in decades. His 50 points weren't just a career-high; they were a franchise-altering statement.

While Muresan’s offensive explosion was the main event, he was far from a one-man band. Point guard Chris Whitney orchestrated the assault with precision, dishing out 15 assists, with the vast majority of his feeds finding their way into the massive hands of his centerpiece. The Bullets' offense ran with ruthless efficiency, flowing through their colossal center.

The Spurs, simply overwhelmed, had no counter. Avery Johnson’s 14 points and 8 assists were a mere footnote on a night defined by one man’s greatness. This wasn't just a win for the Washington Bullets; it was a night where a player transcended the game, etching his name into the record books with a performance that will be remembered for generations.
